CI/CD: cibuildwheel wheel building and PyPI publishing
description:
Add cibuildwheel-based CI/CD workflows to build and publish wheels for vtt-transcribe.

**Scope:**
- Build wheels for Python 3.10-3.14 across multiple platforms (Linux, macOS, Windows)
- Separate core and diarization wheel builds
- Gate diarization wheels to Python 3.10-3.13 (torch compatibility)
- Python 3.14 builds core only (no torch/diarization)
- Conditional execution: diarization jobs run only on main branch (skip PRs)
- Publish to TestPyPI and PyPI using OIDC authentication
- Support wheel builds for both x86_64 and arm64 architectures

**Related Infrastructure:**
- Existing CI workflows (ci.yml, docker-build-test.yml)
- PyPI publishing workflows (publish.yml, publish-testpypi.yml)
- Docker image builds with diarization support

**Success Criteria:**
- Automated wheel builds on tag push/release
- Wheels available on PyPI for all supported Python versions
- Clear documentation of build matrix and gating rules
- CI costs controlled through selective diarization builds
notes: Closed: vtt-transcribe is a pure Python package - cibuildwheel is not needed. Universal wheels (py3-none-any) work on all platforms. Implemented workflow improvements in PR #197 instead (lint gates, dry-run defaults, tag trigger fixes).

notes:
## COMPLETED (2026-02-04)

**Fixed via PR #186**: https://github.com/JLCodeSource/vtt-transcribe/pull/186

### Solution
Added autouse fixture `mock_stdin_tty` in conftest.py that mocks sys.stdin.isatty() to return True by default for all tests. This prevents stdin mode from activating in tests unless explicitly mocked otherwise.

- Fixed 31 failing tests across test_cli.py, test_handlers.py, test_main.py, test_diarization.py, test_transcriber.py
- All tests passing: 247 passed, 6 skipped, 97% coverage maintained
